review_text: My grandparents were originally from Oslob so being here truly brings me to a full circle. The place is rich with culture, apart from the usual whale watching/tour events. And their local restos really give you an insight to the best food selection that Oslob can offer.

The Cuartel Ruins stand along the coast of the municipality of Oslob on the island of Cebu. It was built by Spaniards back in the 1860s when the Spanish forces colonized the Philippines. The edifice was constructed using thick coral stones that still stand today.
It's a heritage park. There's a church also.
